docs.text: Installation ¶ Onepanel CLI is available on pypi and works on Windows, MacOS and Linux. To install Onepanel's CLI via pip : pip install -U onepanel Note CLI is pre-installed if you are using Onepanel Workspaces or Jobs. Tip The CLI is compatible with Python 2.7.x and Python >= 3.6.x, if you have both versions installed, you will need to use pip3 for Python >= 3.6.x. Authentication ¶ You can connect your Onepanel account to CLI by using the login command where you'll be prompted for your email and password: onepanel login Alternatively, you can create an access token as shown below: And then login as follows: onepanel login -t <access-token> Check version ¶ onepanel --version Help and documentation ¶ You can add --help to any command to view information about its syntax and options, some examples: onepanel jobs --help onepanel jobs create --help
docs.title: Onepanel CLI

docs.text: Onepanel CLI is available on pypi and works on Windows, MacOS and Linux. To install Onepanel's CLI via pip : pip install -U onepanel Note CLI is pre-installed if you are using Onepanel Workspaces or Jobs. Tip The CLI is compatible with Python 2.7.x and Python >= 3.6.x, if you have both versions installed, you will need to use pip3 for Python >= 3.6.x.

docs.text: You can connect your Onepanel account to CLI by using the login command where you'll be prompted for your email and password: onepanel login Alternatively, you can create an access token as shown below: And then login as follows: onepanel login -t <access-token>

docs.text: You can add --help to any command to view information about its syntax and options, some examples: onepanel jobs --help onepanel jobs create --help
docs.title: Help and documentation

docs.text: Installation ¶ Onepanel SDK is available as soon as you install Onepanel CLI Note SDK is pre-installed if you are using Onepanel Workspaces or Jobs. Authentication ¶ The recommended way to authenticate in Onepanel's SDK is to use an access token, you can create an access token as shown below: Then you can authenticate in the SDK as follows: from onepanel.sdk import Client # with username/access_token client = Client ( username = '<username>' , access_token = '<access token>' ) # or with email/access_token client = Client ( email = '<email>' , access_token = '<access token>' ) Examples ¶
docs.title: Onepanel SDK

docs.text: Onepanel SDK is available as soon as you install Onepanel CLI Note SDK is pre-installed if you are using Onepanel Workspaces or Jobs.
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: The recommended way to authenticate in Onepanel's SDK is to use an access token, you can create an access token as shown below: Then you can authenticate in the SDK as follows: from onepanel.sdk import Client # with username/access_token client = Client ( username = '<username>' , access_token = '<access token>' ) # or with email/access_token client = Client ( email = '<email>' , access_token = '<access token>' )
